The article should state that the Golan is in Syria as this is recognized internationally (all world countries except one disputed country) and there is no legitimate reason for not mentioning it.

The Golan lies within Syria according to the UN-recognized international borders and is recognized as so by ALL world countries without a single exception. This is not a suitable topic for discussion.

To Hertz, I believe that most normal people recognize the UN-recognized international borders as the only legitimate borders. Wikipedia shouldn't advocate extreme anti-international law views.
What a UN map shows is hardly the complete story, and the map itself even bears a disclaimer. Returning the previous carefully-crafted balanced wording.
Conforming the terminology to that of the citation
The previous version untruthfully represented the content of the source used - the cited link doesn't anywhere indicate that "53,000 Syrians fled, only that the IDF claimed so.
